title.value: Эффективность применения гербицидов в посевах капусты белокочанной, возделываемой по безрассадной технологии
Effectiveness of herbicides application in white head cabbage crops, cultivated by non-seedling technology

journal.title: Agriculture and Plant Protection : scientific-practical journal

person.name: Prishchepa, I.A., National Academy of Sciences. Scientific and Practical Center for Arable Farming (Belarus). Institute of Plant Protection

abstract.value: In the conditions of the Republic of Belarus  there were presented results of researches on selection and definition of a different spectrum of action herbicides efficiency applied for weed vegetation control in white cabbage (Brassica oleracea convar. capitata var. alba L.) crops cultivated by non-seedling technology are generalized. It is determined that the biological efficiency of soil action herbicides depending on specific weed composition and their density fluctuated from 87 to 92%; the herbicides applied during crop vegetation – from 82 to 91%. In all the trials with herbicides white head cabbage yield increased the control variant value. A result of the research it was found that after planting the cabbage cultivated by field-seeded technology until the sprouting of the crop it was efficient to apply against annual dicotyledonous and grass weeds herbicides teridoks, EC (2.5 l / ha) or Cardinal 500 SC in rates of 1.2-1.8 l / ha, which reduces the number of weed species on 87-92%, vegetative mass of weeds is reduced by 88-93%.
